intro: Racinaea pallidoflavens, commonly known as the pale yellow racinaea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many plants with showy inflorescences. The plant features a short, stout rhizome with broad, arrow-shaped leaves that are often variegated in color. Its flowers are small and clustered in a spadix, enclosed by a modified leaf called a spathe. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and striking floral structure.
